entry.et: French hutte, from Old French hute, from Old High German hutta hut; probably akin to Old English hȳd skin, hide

def.dt: :an often small and temporary dwelling of simple construction :shack

dt.un: used to mark a marching cadence

entry.et: Peter North Nissen †1930 British mining engineer

def.dt: :a prefabricated shelter with a semicircular arching roof of corrugated iron sheeting and a concrete floor
